result.execSummary:
The defendant Corey D Conner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Justice point report received and filed. lr

Defendant Corey D Conner in court with attorney Kevin B. Dunn.  Alyssa M. Schaller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Request for substitution made by defense counsel.  Court consented to substitution against Judge John Siefert, Branch 47.  Defendant is advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case, pursuant to current court rules, to  Judge Protasiewicz, Branch 24.  Case adjourned to Branch 24 for plea conference.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 04-09-2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with: G.M. OR HIS RESIDENCE
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Corey D Conner in court with attorney Joan E. Zawikowski.  Defendant Corey D Conner in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Siefert, Branch 47.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
